docs.title: Website Tracker Documentation
docs.text: An AI-powered website monitoring platform that provides real-time change detection and insights across multiple websites.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Real-time website monitoring
  • AI-powered change detection
  • Visual diff highlighting
  • Personalized monitoring preferences
  • Progress tracking with visual feedback

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
1. Clone the repository
  2. Install dependencies
  3. Configure your OpenAI API key
  4. Run the Streamlit application

docs.title: Architecture
docs.text: The application uses: - Python 3.11 backend - Streamlit web interface - OpenAI for change analysis - Selenium and WebDriver for web scraping

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The Website Tracker API provides programmatic access to website monitoring and change detection features. This documentation covers the core components and their usage.

docs.title: Change Detection
docs.text: The change detection system provides APIs for: - Detecting content changes - Analyzing modifications - Scoring change significance - Visual difference highlighting

docs.title: Timeline Visualization
docs.text: The timeline visualization component offers: - Change history tracking - Visual representation of changes - Filtering and sorting capabilities - Export functionality

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text: API access requires authentication using environment variables: - OPENAI_API_KEY: Required for AI-powered change analysis - Additional keys may be required based on configuration

docs.title: Rate Limits
docs.text:
• Standard rate limits apply to API endpoints
  • Batch operations are recommended for multiple requests
  • Consider caching frequently accessed data

docs.title: Error Handling
docs.text: All API endpoints follow standard HTTP status codes: - 200: Success - 400: Bad Request - 401: Unauthorized - 403: Forbidden - 404: Not Found - 500: Internal Server Error

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: See the individual API component documentation for detailed usage instructions: - Change Detection API - Timeline Visualization API

docs.title: Contributing to Website Tracker
docs.text: Thank you for your interest in contributing to Website Tracker! This guide will help you get started with contributing to the project.

docs.title: Development Setup
docs.text:
1. Fork the repository

  2. Clone your fork: 

    git clone https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/website-tracker.git
cd website-tracker

  3. Create a new branch: 

    git checkout -b feature/your-feature-name

  4. Install development dependencies: 

    pip install -r requirements.txt

docs.title: Running Tests
docs.text:
Run the test suite using pytest: 

python -m pytest

For coverage report: 

python -m pytest --cov=./ --cov-report=xml

docs.title: Code Style
docs.text:
• Follow PEP 8 guidelines
  • Use type hints where possible
  • Write docstrings for functions and classes
  • Include tests for new features

docs.title: Pull Request Process
docs.text:
1. Update documentation for any new features
  2. Add or update tests as needed
  3. Ensure all tests pass
  4. Update CHANGELOG.md with your changes
  5. Submit a pull request to the main branch

docs.title: Commit Messages
docs.text: Follow conventional commits format: - feat: New feature - fix: Bug fix - docs: Documentation changes - test: Adding or updating tests - refactor: Code refactoring - chore: Maintenance tasks

docs.title: Need Help?
docs.text:
• Check existing issues and pull requests
  • Create a new issue for discussion
  • Join our community discussions

docs.title: Website Monitoring Settings
docs.text:
Configure which websites to monitor and how often to check for changes:

{
  "urls": [
    {
      "url": "https://example.com",
      "check_interval": "1h",
      "notify_on_change": true
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: Notification Settings
docs.text: Set up email or other notification methods when changes are detected.

docs.title: OpenAI Integration
docs.text: Configure the AI analysis settings to control how changes are analyzed and summarized.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Python 3.11 or higher
  • OpenAI API key for change analysis
  • Chrome/Firefox for web scraping

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
1. Clone the repository: 

    git clone https://github.com/manicmeta1/website-tracker.git
cd website-tracker

  2. Install dependencies: 

    pip install -r requirements.txt

  3. Configure environment variables: Create a .env file with: 

    OPENAI_API_KEY=your_api_key_here

  4. Start the application: 

    streamlit run main.py

The application will be available at http://localhost:5000
